djf.ui

Class AppYesNoCancelDialogSingleton

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.stage.Window
      • javafx.stage.Stage
        • djf.ui.AppYesNoCancelDialogSingleton
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class AppYesNoCancelDialogSingleton
extends javafx.stage.Stage
    This class serves to present a dialog with three options to the user: Yes, No, or Cancel and lets one access which was selected.

      • init

        public void init(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
        This method initializes the singleton for use.
        Parameters:
        primaryStage - The window above which this dialog will be centered.

      • getSelection

        public java.lang.String getSelection()
        Accessor method for getting the selection the user made.
        Returns:
        Either YES, NO, or CANCEL, depending on which button the user selected when this dialog was presented.

      • show

        public void show(java.lang.String title,
                 java.lang.String message)
        This method loads a custom message into the label then pops open the dialog.
        Parameters:
        title - The title to appear in the dialog window bar.
        message - Message to appear inside the dialog.
